main event: A solid, shimmery object was observed on radar descending from around 32,000 feet to 9,000 feet before disappearing.
interesting points: The object was seen descending with intermittent flashing and pulsing.
The object appeared as a small, intermittent blip on the radar scope.
The object's course was unknown, but it seemed to descend rapidly before disappearing.
The sighting lasted for about 20 minutes.

A separate witness reported seeing a white, cigar-shaped object around 400 feet long and 100 feet wide moving silently and slowly in a northerly direction at around 1,000 feet above the ground. This sighting lasted for about 10 minutes.
sighted object: a solid, shimmery object on radar, and a white, cigar-shaped object
witnesses: radar operator, and a separate witness on the ground
photographs: no photographs included in the report
